Uses of Class
com.sats.JDate

    • Uses of JDate in com.sats

      Methods in com.sats that return JDate 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JDate JDate.add(int days)
      This method returns the date after adding the no of Days as passed in the argument
      JDate JDate.add(int field, int amount)
      This method returns the date after adding the "amount" to the "field" passed
      JDate JDate.getDateComponent()
      This method removes the time component of a JDate and returns only the date component
      JDate JDate.rolldown(int field)
      This calls an "subtract" with value for decrement as 1
      JDate JDate.rollup(int field)
      This calls an "add" with value for increment as 1
      JDate JDate.subtract(int days)
      This method returns the date after subtracting the no of days passed
      JDate JDate.subtract(int field, int amount)
      This method returns the date after subtracting the "amount" to the "field" passed
      Methods in com.sats with parameters of type JDate 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int JDate.getDaysBetween(JDate anotherDate)
      This gives the difference between "this" and another Date in "number of days"
      Important note:
      The function removes the 'time' component and uses only the 'date' component while computing the difference '03-Jan-2012 01:00 AM' and '02-Jan-2012 11:30 PM' will result in "1" as output.
